metadata.title: CVE-2016-4024 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in imlib2 before 1.4.9 on 32-bit platforms allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via large dimensions in an image, whichtriggers an out-of-bounds heap memory write operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libimlib2 - 1.4.7-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imlib2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.7-1ubuntu0.1').
